messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Our Volcano Worked!!!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/28/2005 4:11:39 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... It really did errupt last year, at least a couple of times.   They weren t 1980-sized
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/28/2005 4:11:39 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
hoffmanwilson@... writes:

> it since my son has an interest on and off of
> volcanoes since last year when
> Mt. St. Helens was supposedly going to erupt.

It really did errupt last year, at least a couple of
times. They weren't 1980-sized AWESOME erruptions,
but she did...well, burp, I guess ;)



Wow, they never really broadcast it much out here in MA... we mostly kept
checking in on the live webcam daily. That's really cool to see.

Jenny
Mom to Danny, Kelsey and Evelyn
Happily homeschooling in Greenfield
~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~
Learning is a treasure that will follow its owner everywhere. ~Chinese
Proverb

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Our Volcano Worked!!!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/27/2005 9:01:47 PM Eastern Daylight Time, aplan4life@yahoo.com writes: We ended  up using a syphon vacuum hose for a fish tank.  We put
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/27/2005 9:01:47 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
aplan4life@... writes:

We ended up using a syphon vacuum hose for a fish
tank. We put the chocolate in the top and held it up
high, the other end was inside our volcano and
chocolate syrup oozed on out. Moved the brownies and
everything!



Oh yum... can't wait to see! Sounds real yummy though! I might have to try
it since my son has an interest on and off of volcanoes since last year when
Mt. St. Helens was supposedly going to erupt.

Jenny
Homeschooling in Greenfield
Danny (12-1-99), Kelsey (11-1-01) and Evelyn (5-19-04)
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Education is not filling a pail but the lighting of a fire. ~William Butler
Yeats

messages.subject: Our Volcano Worked!!!
messages.msgSnippet: I will upload to my blogspot later, after I figure out how.  Just wanted to share with everyone that it was a success. We ended up using a syphon vacuum hose
messages.messageBody:
I will upload to my blogspot later, after I figure out
how. Just wanted to share with everyone that it was a
success.

We ended up using a syphon vacuum hose for a fish
tank. We put the chocolate in the top and held it up
high, the other end was inside our volcano and
chocolate syrup oozed on out. Moved the brownies and
everything!

Thanks for all your input!

Peace and Joy,
~Sandy
www.homelearningnaturally.blogspot.com
